news_header: Finnish citizens struggle to succeed in EU official recruitment, with a notable decline in interest and performance in selection tests.
news_original_title: Juuso Järviniemi läpäisi kokeet EU-virkamieheksi: ”Ei tarvitse olla huippunero”
news_text: Finnish citizens are not performing well in seeking EU positions, with a notable decline in interest and success in selection tests. Juuso Järviniemi, who secured a position in the EU Commission, reflects on the challenges faced by Finns in the recruitment process. The Finnish Permanent Representation in Brussels highlights that unfamiliarity with the application procedures and structured interviews contributes to poor performance. National competitions for EU positions are being considered to improve representation from under-represented countries like Finland. The EU is also experimenting with a large recruitment drive, but many Finns feel they are competing against all of Europe. Järviniemi emphasizes that with good preparation, success is achievable.
